intro: Handroanthus selachidentatus, commonly known as the "saw-toothed flame tree," is a species of flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Bignoniaceae family and is characterized by its striking, orange-red flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant has elongated, serrated leaves that give it its common name, and it thrives in tropical and subtropical climates. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value due to its vibrant floral display and adaptability to various soil types.
